description.narrative: The goal is to help the Gov of KR to strengthen the enabling environment & ecosystems that would advance the opportunities for youth (women) in digital economy, support their better integration into global development community, create sustainable jobs

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Approval of the National Digital Skills Development Strategy 1.2 At least 700 regular graduation each year (students participated at the new training programmes) 1.3 % of girls participated at the new training programmes 1.4 # of teachers with increased capacity on new digital skills development 1.5 # of students employed after graduation 2.1 Fully operational IT hub in Osh province with # of full-time residents 2.2 # of participants of hackathon events 2.3 # of youth trained at IThubOsh 2.4 % of girls participated in the IT courses 2.5 # of teachers trained at IThubOsh 2.6 % of youth employed after graduation

Component 1. Improved digital skills development in the system of formal education • The National Strategy on Digital Skills and Competencies and Roadmap draft was cleared by MoES and it is under final endorsement of the President Office. • Improved, connected, and integrated existing systems with educational services are used and disseminated among other institutes and colleges under KSTU and OshTU: - Google G-Suite for Education; - Microsoft 365 for Education; - International education service Eduroam. • Additional 3 (International Alatoo University, Chui University and private high school) private universities were connected to the Oracle Academy and at least 1,000 students and 50 university teachers benefited from that practice.
Component 2. Established ITHubOsh in Osh City for young entrepreneurs and application of new learning models in non-formal educational settings • Facilitated intensive knowledge exchange and masterclasses, the digital-savvy experts from Russian Federation, Skolkovo were engaged in Innovative Ecosystem and Technological Trends. Developed report and published on the web in three languages. Conducted 8 webinars with High Technology Park in Kyrgyzstan. • World Bank project implementation unit under the Ministry of Education and Science continued conducting TOTs that UNDP’s developed contents for all schoolteacher in the country. • IT Hub in Osh - Due to sustainability and competencies, it was decided to work with a private sector. PF WelcomeKG offered a 986m2 building in the center of the Osh city; - Responsible Party Agreement was signed with PF WelcomeKG to establish IT Hub in Osh; - IT Hub established in close partnership with the State High Technology Park.
The Project is at the final stage till the end of Feb 2022.
To be reported after project closure.
